name: Network Multiplexing
description: Sector template for network multiplexing patents including TDM, WDM, and channel access.
contextDescription: Network multiplexing patents cover channel sharing and bandwidth allocation. Key areas include TDMA/TDM, OFDM, WDM (optical), and resource scheduling. High-value targets include optical network vendors (Ciena, Infinera), wireless infrastructure (Nokia, Ericsson), and broadband access (DOCSIS). Optical multiplexing is critical for backbone capacity.
scoringGuidance: WDM/DWDM patents target optical network vendors (Ciena, Infinera).
OFDM patents apply to WiFi, LTE, and 5G.
Resource scheduling patents target wireless base stations.
PON multiplexing patents target FTTH deployments.

questions.question: What multiplexing technique does this cover (TDM, FDM, WDM, OFDM, CDMA)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the multiplexing technique and its applications.

questions.question: Is this relevant to optical networking (WDM, coherent, PON)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Optical is critical for backbone and metro networks.

questions.question: Is this relevant to wireless access (WiFi, cellular, satellite)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Wireless multiplexing is essential for spectrum efficiency.
